abstract: The activist investor disclosed on Wednesday that he had raised his stake in WebMD to 11.64 percent from 9.99 percent and called on the online health company to buy back up to $1 billion of its shares.
snippet: The activist investor disclosed on Wednesday that he had raised his stake in WebMD to 11.64 percent from 9.99 percent and called on the online health company to buy back up to $1 billion of its shares.
lead_paragraph: Carl C. Icahn won’t be deterred by WebMD‘s woes.

byline.original: By Michael J. de la Merced
